reviews.review: Barney Calhoun
关于解决WIN10闪退的方法，你们进入游戏后，把输入法换成微软拼音，并切换成英文即可，该方法同样适用于HL、HLOF、CS、CZ

A good little side adventure in the Half-Life universe featuring Barney Calhoun

A nice perspective on barney during the resonance cascade.
The game took me around three hours to complete, so it is a little too short, but I still liked it.
Another good expansion of the Half-Life series, strongly recommended.

作为半衰期的另一个资料片不得不说游戏时长真的短，没有任何新武器，新敌人，但是可以看到前期的弗里曼进入实验室的场景和G-Man坐电车的场景也很激动，游戏性还好，几乎没有Boss级别的生物导致比较简单。
总体来说可以考虑大合集一起喜加一

Not nearly as good as [b]Gearbox[/b]'s fist expansion to [b]Valve[/b]'s [b]Half-Life[/b] ([b]Opposing Force[/b]). For many reasons. First of all, it was released in [b]2001[/b]. Three years after the original game and two years after the [b]Opposing Force[/b]. And, even though I was completely in love with [b]Half-Life[/b] back in the days, I can't say I cared much at that point. Three years of [b]Half-Life[/b] was more than enough.

The funniest thing, though, I always wanted to play as one of those security officers back then. They may look kind of silly for modern kids, but back in the days? Those looked totally cool. Blue uniform, bulletproof vests... those were awesome. So, even though I felt like I had enough, I still bought this expansion (still have my first physical copy on me, even though [b]Steam[/b] offers us more convenient digital version now). I mean, sure, in [b]2001[/b] [b]Half-Life[/b] was an old news. [b]2001[/b] brought us games like [b]Aliens Versus Predator 2[/b], [b]Clive Barker's Undying[/b], [b]HALO: Combat Evolved[/b], [b]Return to Castle Wolfenstein[/b], [b]TRIBES 2[/b], [b]AquaNox[/b] and many others, so, looking back at [b]Half-Life[/b] felt a lot like a waste of time, but... [i]dang[/i], I just wanted that blue uniform in my life.

Unfortunately, like I've already said, [b]Blue Shift[/b] turned out to be a disappointment. And not only because technically, it was a [b]1998[/b] game released in [b]2001[/b] (let's not forget that technology used to evolve [i]way[/i] faster than it does today and three years used to be a [i]huge[/i] period of time). [b]Half-Life[/b] looked way too good for its time to had a chance years later. And even though it was unable to look competitive enough in [b]2001[/b], it was still possible to forget about [b]AVP2[/b] for a moment and make yourself to look back at [b]Half-Life[/b] for a bit more. The problem was – [b]Gearbox[/b] guys were unable to provide us with anything new. Literally, anything.

When [b]Opposing Force[/b] came out, it offered tons of new content. A lot of interesting new weapons, night vision, ropes, [b]Barnacle[/b] as a [b]Zelda[/b]-like hookshot, the ability to give orders to the friendly soldiers... It was a whole new experience. [b]Blue Shift[/b]? It has nothing like that. Everything that was added in previous expansion was completely removed (literally, everything) and... nothing new was added. [b]Blue Shift[/b] has no new weapons, [b]Blue Shift[/b] has no new features and even the training here is exactly the same with the original [b]Half-Life[/b]. Heck, even the story is a huge disappointment. Sure, you'll still see some old events from the new point of view (our new hero, [b]Barney Calhoun[/b] is that security officer that you can see near the closed door at the very beginning of the original game), but... that's pretty much it. [b]Gearbox[/b] were unable to come out with anything interesting for [b]Calhoun[/b]. And as the result, this expansion feels both lacking and forced. Like something that was made “just because”, with no special idea or reason.

The only difference in gameplay here is that [b]Barney[/b] doesn't have any power armor. But guess what? It only makes the game worse. Since you can't use the armor chargers anymore, since your only way to get some armor is to find the new vest and since there's less weapon in this game than in both previous titles, we ended up having way ([i]WAY[/i]) less enemies and no final boss whatsoever. Yeah... it's [i]that[/i] disappointing. So disappointing that we can't even get a proper boss. Even the story is anticlimactic. [b]Blue Shift[/b] is a game about how security officer and a couple of scientists tried to escape... and succeed. No [b]G-Man[/b] intervention, no badass monster, no big revelation, nothing like that. Boring, boring, [i]boring[/i] stuff.

And guess what? Bad stuff doesn't even end here. For example, [b]Blue Shift[/b] doesn't offer enough outdoor experience (no helicopters, no bombing, no dam...), most of the time it'll be all about sewers and tunnels (which all look the same), while alien world parts are especially annoying here. Can't say that level design is a complete disaster, but there's something to ruin even that. The thing is, [b]Blue Shift[/b] comes with way too much scripted stuff and interactions with the [b]NPC[/b]s are way too painful. How should I put it... let's just say that ol' man [b]Romero[/b] is not the only one who can make you his bitch. Clearly, [b]Gearbox[/b] played [b]DAIKATANA[/b]. The question is... who in the right mind would think that it'll be a good idea to do the same thing after playing [b]DAIKATANA[/b]?!

Well, [b]Gearbox[/b] did. And they ended up with pretty much the same exact set of problems. Half-broken scripts, weird bugs and that exact epic [b]NPC[/b] / doors fiasco. Sure, [b]Blue Shift[/b] doesn't feel nearly as bad as early versions of [b]DAIKATANA[/b], but you can totally expect the important [b]NPC[/b] saying something like “[i]we're close![/i]” and then starting to run in a totally opposite direction with an incredible speed.

Sure, [b]Blue Shift[/b] is still a [b]Half-Life[/b] game. And if you're a die-hard fan of the original game, you still have a chance to enjoy your time here. At least up to a certain degree. But, let's be honest, it's far from being good. It's forced, it's boring, it doesn't offer any new features, while failing to provide even the most basic things (like boss battles), there's almost no story, there's too much scripted stuff, [b]DAIKATANA[/b]-like content is annoying, etc, etc, etc. [b]Blue Shift[/b] was the last attempt to make more money from [b]Half-Life[/b], but instead of being blast from the past, it ended up being a cold dumpling. And, let me quote one of my most favorite fantasy writers out there, “[i]there's nothing as sad as a cold dumpling[/i]”.

WOW! Leading up to Half-Life: Alyx I started replaying all the Half-Life's and I am shocked to say that this is BETTER than the original! While Half-Life 1 is a crowning achievement of SP FPS games, it does have it's fair share of pacing issues, specifically Xen. Blue Shift is considerably shorter (dur it's an xpac), but because of this the game never lets up. That final sequence in particular had my heart racing, not knowing how Barn Barns was gonna finally escape Black Mesa.

I can kind of see where the fanbase is coming from when they collectively told me that Blue Shift is the weakest out of the OG Half-Life games. It's painfully short, you barely get any guns, and the Xen level is a f*cking maze. However, it's still Half-Life, and I really enjoyed it regardless. The level design and combat and puzzles, like always, are excellent. I'm glad that Barney got some backstory, but I honestly don't see myself returning to Blue Shift anytime soon.

本編、OppsingForceとプレイしてからの今作プレイ。

雰囲気は本編と同じだが、エイリアン要素がやや少なめ。
武器も普通のやつだけ（自分が取りそこねてなければ）
個人的にはそっちのほうが好み。

評判どおり短かったが、正直HL2に向けての消化試合なので、
コンパクトにまとまっていてよかった。

OppsingForce同様、ゲーム中は英語音声のみ（字幕もなし）なので、
自分レベルの英語能力では全然聞き取れなかった。
聞き取れた部分と周囲の状況で判断してなんとかクリア。

つまらないとまでは言わないが、いまさらプレイする理由はないのかなと。
Довольно интересная история, если не знаете во, что поиграть. Расширяет мир основной игры. Рекомендую к ознакомлению.

Даже если не принимать во внимание вопросы каноничности,  ощущение, что игру делали на коленке.

Самый тупой подход к уровню сложности в виде увеличения получаемого урона и уменьшению исходящего.
К вопросам о диайзне уровней, я просто не знаю. Делал все максимально аккуратно, стараясь не тратить лишний боезапас и избегать столкновений.  Буллскидов и вортигонтов убивал монтировкой, НО ПРИ ЭТОМ УМУДРИЛСЯ СОФТЛОКНУТСЯ В ТУННЕЛЕ. 
Я НЕ ЗНАЮ КТО В ВАШЕЙ МАЛЕНЬКОЙ ИНДИЙСКОЙ КОМПАНИИ РЕШИЛ, ЧТО КОМБИНАЦИЯ ИЗ СКРИПТОВАННОГО ПАДЕНИЯ С ЛЕСТНИЦЫ, ОПУСКАЮЩЕГО ХП ДО КРАСНОГО УРОВНЯ,  И ИЗ ПОЛНОГО ОТСУТСТВИЯ  ДАЛЬНЕЙШИХ  РЕСУРСОВ, В ЧАСТНОСТИ МЕДПАКЕТОВ  И ПАТРОНОВ - ХОРОШАЯ ИДЕЯ.

Я потратил около получаса-часа на прохождение сранного тоннеля и так и просто дропнул к чертям. 

КТО ПОБЕДИТ? 16 хп + 4 патрона в револьвере + 1 патрон в дробовике, ЛИБО 10+ Вортигонтов и 6+ хедкрабов в практически ОТКРЫТОМ ПРОСТРАНСТВЕ, место с электрическим уроном  И БОЧКИ, КОТОРЫЕ НУЖНО ВЗОРВАТЬ, ЯВНО НЕ МОНТИРОВКОЙ.  При том, что вортигонты в некоторых местах спавнятся группами, как и хедкрабы. 
На все про все у меня 4 выстрела из револьвера, либо 3 выстрела из револьвера и 1 выстрел из дробовика.
На одного вортигонта уходит 2 выстрела из револьвера, либо 2 выстрела из дробовика. На одного хедкраба по одному выстрелу. 
Используем выжившие мозговые клетки, чтобы посчитать минимальное число убийств монтировкой, необходимое совершить в открытом пространстве против групп мобов.
16-4=12. Как минимум 12.

In this expansion you play as Barney (who is a main character in Half-Life 2), one of the many security guards in the Black Mesa Research Facility. While I'd definitely say the main game and Opposing Force are better, this was still really fun to play, especially if you're wanting more after.

Ce jeu est un bon jeu même si en plus d'etre le jeu Half Life le plus court (je l'ai fait en seulement 4 heures), il est aussi celui que j'ai le mois aimé dans tous les jeux Half Life auxquels j'ai joué mais il reste un très bon jeu que je conseille bien évidemment !

Short, boring, unrewarding. No new weapons, enemies or even an endgame boss and it's like four chapters long. You play as a character that would eventually become canon in HL2 so I guess that's something. Play Opposing Force instead.

I would give this expansion a 7/10. I completed a full run in about 2 hours on the "Normal" difficulty. You play as Barney Calhoun, a guard in Black Mesa during the events of Half-Life. In my opinion, this expansion isn't very difficult. There aren't many puzzles and they are pretty simple, I completed them in a couple of minutes. For most of the game, you will be fighting Marines and the weaker aliens present in the first game. The only new content is the armor system, which replaces Half-Life's H.E.V. Suit with a security vest and helmet. Most of the weapons return from Half-Life and are exactly the same. Since this expansion came out after Opposing Force and lacks a lot of the new content Opposing Force had, Blue Shift isn't appreciated as much. I would recommend playing this for any fan of the series, especially if you like Half-Life 2.

[h1]Half-Life: Blue Shift - 3 сценки с Фрименом или спасти свою зaдницу любой ценой.[/h1]

[i]Так как являюсь фанатом первой и второй части Half-Life, то решил не проходить мимо двух популярных дополнений. То ли "меня подкупил" синий цвет значка, то ли обложка, то ли тот самый охранник, что не мог пройти в дверь, однако из двух дополнений я запустил именно Blue Shift, а в итоге очень зря.[/i]

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
1. Ландшафт. Начало игры вполне понравилось. Шкафчики охранников, уборная, тир, автоматы с едой и так далее. Не смотря на то, что локации не такого уж и большого размера, но сделано всё вполне удобно и уютно. В дальнейшем прохождении можно заметить, что ящики частенько наполнены амуницией и аптечками, поэтому проблем с патронами или здоровьем явно не будет что на низкой, что на высокой сложностях.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
1. "Барни, барни, барни". Неужели настолько было лень вылепить несколько разных моделей? Можно в принципе свихнуться от того, какое количество Барни встречается за игру. Считая одинаковые модели, я сбился примерно на 10-ом Барни, а ведь это не просто какой-то мод, а вполне себе полноценный аддон. Пахнет халтурой.

2. "Барни, купи мне газировку". Игра проходится примерно за час-полтора и процентов 30-40 игры вы будете постоянно слышать: Барни, тебе следует *сделать то*, Барни, *сделай, пожалуйста, это*, Барни, *смотайся туда и сюда*. То вас телепортируют в Зен (даже без костюма HEV, серьезно?), то вам нужно зарядить батарею, то требуется найти определенного ученого. Спасибо, что хоть не заставили убить Нихиланта, а то во Фримене и вовсе бы не было необходимости.

3. "Ну и... Что делать дальше?". Игра до невероятности непредсказуемая. Мало того, что она ломается постоянно (более 2 раз скрипты просто не срабатывали при переходе на новый уровень и приходилось загружаться до других сохранений), так ещё и сидишь и вдупляешь что делать дальше. Не удивляйтесь, если вы будете минут 5-10 подряд бегать туда-сюда и пытаться понять что же в конце концов делать.

4. "И это всё?". Извините за спойлеры, но игра заканчивается на тупейшем: [spoiler]"Всем пока, мы поехали домой"[/spoiler]. До сих пор не понимаю: так зачем создавалась данная игра? Ради этих 3 сценок, где мы видим Фримена от чужого лица? А что новое-то хоть? Винтовку ввели, модель пистолета новую нарисовали? Мало того, что вырезали большую часть оружий из hl1, так ещё и не добавили НИЧЕГО НОВОГО. Ни врагов, ни оружий, ни новых текстур, ни новых композиций. Нудятина. Мне бы было стыдно такое выпускать.

[b]Итог: не могу даже близко поставить рекомендацию за это. Слишком много убогих скриптов, где враги даже на последней сложности не успевают хотя бы начать стрельбу по вам. Игра осыпает вас патронами и аптечками настолько, что можно зачищать всё только дробовиком и автоматом. Очень короткая, а в конце до такой степени халтурная, что заставляет вас просто стоять и нажимать на кнопку 3 раза с задержкой в 20 секунд. Думаю, тут и без меня понятно, что игру просто начали доить и вышло это недоразумение в виде Blue Shift. Скучное, однообразное, абсолютно ненужное и серое.[/b]
Una buena ampliacion, nos muestra las cosas de otra perspectiva

Mentre Gordon Freeman era a Black Mesa in Half Life 1
tra i sopravvissuti alle "impreviste consequenze" 
dell'esperimento nel settore segreto LAMBDA
alcuni scienziati e personale di servizio riescono a sfuggire
dal centro ricerche allontanandosi attraverso zone 
del centro ricerche ancora non completamente infestate dagli XEN
e dai militari giunti a "risolvere" uno scomodo problema.

Tra questi sopravvissuti c'è la guardia di sicurezza di terzo livello 
Barney Calhum , Amico di Gordon e futuro capo della Resistenza 
in Half Life 2. Questo capitolo a lui dedicato mostra come 
si è svolta dal suo punto di vista la fuga da Black Mesa. 

Il capitolo non è lunghissimo ed è dedicato ai veri appassionati 
di Half Life, le meccaniche di gioco sono praticamente uguali.
Ma è un pezzo che completa l'esperienza di questa saga
meglio ancora se fatto prima di Half Life 2.
Forse meglio se comprato in promozione 
visto che non è lunghissimo ed è un gioco ormai 
abbastanza datato. Ovviamente non aspettatevi grafica eccezionale
ma sostanzialmente la stessa (insieme alla meccanica di gioco) di HL1
di cui è quasi contemporaneo anche come uscita.

P.S. se non settate il mouse con i comandi in Raw 
per guardare intorno a voi,
e non imparate a salvare (e caricare) 
in alcuni punti intermedi delle missioni
l'esperienza di gioco potrebbe risultare frustrante...
una volta impostato e capito ciò il gioco
è abbastanza fluido anche se non privo di punti 
in cui potreste non riuscire a capire come proseguire.

aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

[h1] HALF LİFE : BLUE SHIFT [/h1]

Blue Shift, Half-Life 1'e gelmiş olan iki DLC'den [i] (Opposing Force ve Blue Shift) [/i] ikincisi.
Oyunun hikayesi orijinal Half-Life 1 ile paralel olarak işleniyor. İlk DLC olan Opposing Force'a göre oynanış süresi oldukça kısa ve oyunun müzikleri [i] (1 tanesi hariç) [/i] Opposing Force ile aynı.

Blue Shift'te Meksika'daki Black Mesa Araştırma Merkezinde güvenlik görevlisi olan [u] ''Barney Calhoun'' [/u] isimli karakteri canlandırıyoruz ve Barney'in macerası Half-Life'ın orjinal hikayesine hiçbir katkıda bulunmuyor. [i] (Fakat Half-Life 2'deki Barney karakterinin hangi yollardan geçerek ikinci oyuna dahil olduğunu görüyoruz.) [/i] Silahlar orijinal Half-Life ile aynı, yeni düşman da yok aradaki tek fark, güvenlik görevlisi olan Barney’in H.E.V [i] (Zararlı Ortam Giysisi) [/i] kullanmaması. Çok zor bulmacalar, çok komplike harita dizaynları, hatta bölüm sonu canavarı da yok. Sadece [u] ''Resonance Cascade'' [/u] olayını bir de Barney'in gözünden görüyoruz.

Half-Life evrenini ve oynanış mekanikleri seviyorsanız bir göz atın derim.

[h1] İNCELEME PUANI : 70 / 100 [/h1]

E foarte bun acest joc,practic iti arata actiunea lui Half-Life 1 din alta perspectiva,lucru foarte tare.
Recomand acest joc,chiar merita jucat.
